articles.title: Archeologists uncover "lost valley" of ancient cities in the Amazon rainforest - CBS News
articles.description: Recent mapping by laser-sensor technology revealed the sites to be part of a dense network of settlements that lasted about 1,000 years.
articles.content:
Archeologists have uncovered a cluster of lost cities in the Amazon rainforest that was home to at least 10,000 farmers around 2,000 years ago.
